issue: OCR Quality Problem - Root Cause Identified

ocr_extraction.problem: Image is overexposed (brightness: 238.54) causing very poor OCR quality
sample_lines: Give us feedback survey. walnart.con a & E

parsing_result.problem: Parser cannot extract items from garbled OCR text

findings.root_cause: Image preprocessing is NOT working correctly. The image is overexposed but the preprocessing is only applying downscaling, not brightness/contrast adjustment.
evidence: OCR confidence is only 31% (should be 70-90% for good quality)
Only downscaling was applied: '[OCR Preprocess] Downscaling high-resolution image (0.5x)'
No brightness/contrast adjustment despite warning: 'Image is overexposed (brightness: 238.54)'

solution: Fix image preprocessor to handle overexposed images before OCR
